libraries and various NET languages Async based off the Task concept which encapsulates set operations completed Tasks are distinct from threads and may not rely threads require CPU time much all endpoint async operation csharp string url http someUrl HttpClient client new HttpClient string json await client GetStringAsync url The call client GetStringAsync url does not block but instead capabilities discouraged since you longer get the benefit verifiability nor will your code allowed run all environments The best practice confine unsafe code much possible and that the vast majority code type safe TODO Examples Notes The term NET runtime used throughout the document accomodate for the multiple implementations NET such CLR Mono IL2CPP and others The more specific names are only understand how the NET platform enables multi language development and understand how works Common Type System start from the beggining remember that the NET platform language agnostic This doesn just mean that programmer can write her code any language that can compiled also means that she needs able interact with code written other languages that are able used the NET platform order this transparently there has common way describe all supported types This what the Common Type System CTS charge doing was made several things Establish framework for cross language execution Provide object oriented model support implementing various languages NET platform Define set rules that all languages must follow when comes working with types Provide library that contains the basic primitive types that are used application development Boolean Byte Char etc CTS defines two main kinds types that should supported reference and value types Their names point their definitions Reference types objects are represented reference the object actual value reference here similar pointer simply refers memory location where the objects values are This has profound impact how these types are used you assign reference type variable and then pass that variable into method for instance any changes the object will reflected the main object there copying Value types are the opposite where the objects are represented their vaulues you assign value type variable you are essentially copying value the object CTS defines several categories types each with their specific semantics and usage Classes Structures Enums Interfaces Delegates CTS also defines all other properties the types such access modifiers what are valid type members how inheritance and overloading works and Unfortunately going deep into any those beyond the scope introductory article such this but you can consult More resources section the end for links more depth content that covers these topics Common Language Specification enable full interoperability scenarios all objects that are created code must rely some commonality the languages that are consuming them are their callers Since there are numerous different languages NET platform has specified those commonalities something called the Common Language Specification CLS CLS defines set features that are needed many common applications also provides sort recipe for any language that implemented top NET platform what needs support CLS subset the CTS This means that all the rules the CTS also apply the CLS unless the CLS rules are more strict component built using only the rules the CLS that exposes only the CLS features its API said CLS compliant For instance the framework librares are CLS compliant precisely because they need work across all the languages that are supported the NET platform You can consult the documents the More Resources section below get overview all the features the CLS More resources Common Type System conceptualdoc/!gc-overview.md.title: Garbage Collection
conceptualdoc/!gc-overview.md.keywords: Garbage Collection Garbage collection one most important features the NET managed code platform The garbage collector manages allocating and releasing memory for you You not need how allocate and release memory manage the lifetime the objects that use that memory allocation made any time you new object value type boxed Allocations are typically very fast When there isn enough memory allocate object the must collect and dispose garbage memory make memory available for new allocations This process called garbage collection The garbage collector serves automatic memory manager provides the following benefits Enables you develop your application without having free memory Allocates objects the managed heap efficiently Reclaims objects that are longer being used clears their memory and keeps the memory available for future allocations Managed objects automatically get clean content start with their constructors not have initialize every data field Provides memory safety making sure that object cannot use the content another object The NET generational and has generations Each generation has its own heap that uses for storage allocated objects There basic principle that most objects are either short lived long lived Generation where objects are first allocated Objects often don live past the first generation since they are longer use out scope the time the next garbage collection occurs Generation quick collect because its associated heap small Generation really second chance space Objects that are short lived but survive the generation collection often based coincidental timing generation Generation collections are also quick because its associated heap also small The first two heaps remain small because objects are either collected are promoted the next generation heap Generation where all long lived objects are The generation heap can grow very large since the objects contains can survive long time and there generation heap further promote objects The has has additional heap for large objects called the Large Object Heap LOH reserved for objects that are 000 bytes greater byte array Byte with 85k elements would example large object Large objects are not allocated the generational heaps but are allocated directly the LOH Generation and LOH collections can take noticeable time for programs that have run for long time operate over large amounts data Large server programs are known have heaps the 10s GBs The employs variety techniques reduce the amount time that blocks program execution The primary approach much garbage collection work possible background thread way that does not interfere with program execution The also exposes few ways for developers influence its behavior which can quite useful improve performance For more information see Garbage Collection http msdn microsoft com library 0xy59wtx aspx MSDN

conceptualdoc/!delegates-lambdas.md.title: Delegates and lambdas
conceptualdoc/!delegates-lambdas.md.keywords: Delegates and lambdas Delegates define type which specify particular method signature method static instance that satisfies this signature can assigned variable that type then called directly with the appropriate arguments passed argument itself another method and then called The following example demonstrates delegate use csharp public class Program public delegate string Reverse string static string ReverseString string return new string Reverse ToArray static void Main string args Reverse rev ReverseString Console WriteLine rev string line create delegate type certain signature this case method that takes string parameter and then returns string parameter line define the implementation the delegate providing method that has the exact same signature line the method assigned type that conforms the Reverse delegate Finally line invoke the delegate passing string reversed order streamline the development process NET includes set delegate types that programmers can reuse and not have create new types These are Func Action and Predicate and they can used various places throughout the NET APIs without the need define new delegate types course there are some differences between the three you will see their signatures which mostly have with the way they were meant used Action used when there need perform action using the arguments the delegate Func used usually when you have transformation hand that you need transform the arguments the delegate into different result Projections are prime example this Predicate used when you need determine the argument satisfies the condition the delegate can also written Func bool can now take our example above and rewrite using the Func delegate instead custom type The program will continue running exactly the same csharp public class Program static string ReverseString string return new string Reverse ToArray static void Main string args Func string string rev ReverseString Console WriteLine rev string For this simple example having method defined outside the Main method seems bit superfluous because this that NET Framework introduced the concept anonymous delegates With their support you are able create inline delegates without having specify any additional type method You simply inline the definition the delegate where you need For example are going switch and use our anonymous delegate filter out list only even numbers and then print them the console csharp public class Program public static void Main string args List int list new List int for int 100 list Add List int result list FindAll delegate int return foreach var item result Console WriteLine item Notice the highlighted lines you can see the body the delegate just set expressions any other delegate But instead being separate definition introduced hoc our call the FindAll method the List type However even with this approach there still much code that can throw away This where lambda expressions come into play Lambda expressions just lambdas for short were introduced first one the core building blocks Language Integrated Query LINQ They are just more convenient syntax for using delegates They declare signature and method body but don have formal identity their own unless they are assigned delegate Unlike delegates they can directly assigned the left hand side event registration various Linq clauses and methods Since lambda expression just another way specifying delegate should able rewrite the above sample use lambda expression instead anonymous delegate csharp public class Program public static void Main string args List int list new List int for int 100 list Add List int result list FindAll foreach var item result Console WriteLine item you take look the highlighted lines you can see how lambda expression looks like Again just very convenient syntax for using delegates what happens under the covers similar what happens with the anonymous delegate conceptualdoc/!class-libraries.md.title: NET Class Libraries
conceptualdoc/!class-libraries.md.keywords: NET Class Libraries Class libraries are the shared library http wikipedia org wiki Library_ computing Shared_libraries concept for NET They enable you componentize useful functionality into modules that can used multiple applications They can also used means loading functionality that not needed not known application startup Class libraries are described using the NET Assembly file format assembly format There are three types class libraries that you can use Platform specific class libraries have access all the APIs given platform NET Framework Xamarin iOS but can only used apps and libraries that target that platform Portable class libraries have access subset APIs and can used apps and libraries that target multiple platforms NET Core class libraries are merger the platform specific and portable library concept into single model that provides the best both Platform specific Class Libraries Platform specific libraries are bound single NET platform NET Framework Windows and can therefore take significant dependencies known execution environment Such environment will expose known set APIs NET and APIs and will maintain and expose expected state Windows registry Developers who create plaform specific libraries can fully exploit the underlying platform The libraries will only ever run that given platform making platform checks other forms conditional code unnecessary modulo single sourcing code for multiple platforms Platform specific libraries have been the primary class library type for the NET Framework Even other NET platforms emerged platform specific libraries remained the dominant library type Portable Class Libraries Portable libraries are supported multiple NET platforms They can still take dependencies known execution environment however the environment synthetic one that generated the intersection set concrete NET platforms This means that exposed APIs and platform assumptions are subset what would available platform specific library You choose platform configuration when you create portable library These are the set platforms that you need support NET Framework Windows Phone The more platforms you opt support the fewer APIs and fewer platform assumptions you can make the lowest common denominator This characteristic can confusing first since people often think more better but find that more supported platforms results fewer available APIs Many library developers have switched from producing multiple platform specific libraries from one source using conditional compilation directives portable libraries There are several approaches http blog stephencleary com 2012 portable class library enlightenment html for accessing platform specific functionality within portable libraries with bait and switch http log paulbetts org the bait and switch pcl trick being the most widely accepted technique this point NET Core Class Libraries NET Core libraries are replacement the platform specific and portable libraries concepts They are platform specific the sense that they expose all functionality from the underlying platform synthetic platforms platform intersections They are portable the sense that they work all supporting platforms NET Core exposes set library contracts NET platforms must support each contract fully not all Each platform therefore supports set NET Core contracts The corollary that each NET Core class library supported the platforms that support contract dependencies NET Core contracts not expose the entire functionality the NET Framework nor that goal however they expose many more APIs than Portable Class Libraries More APIs will added over time The following platforms support NET Core class libraries NET Core ASP NET NET Framework Windows Store Apps Windows Phone Mono Class Libraries Class libraries are supported Mono including the three types libraries described above Mono has often been seen correctly cross platform implementation the Microsoft NET Framework part this was because platform specific NET Framework libraries could run the Mono runtime without modification compilation This characteristic was place before the creation portable class libraries was obvious choice enable binary portability between the NET Framework and Mono although only worked one direction

providing easy use off the shelf libraries for wide set computing tasks subset these libraries are provided with each NET implementation Base Class Library BCL APIs are expected with any NET implementation both because developers will want them and because popular libraries will need them run App specific libraries above the BCL such ASP NET will not available all NET implementations Base workload Performance always important consideration since apps might prefer particular policy such low latency high throughput low memory low CPU usage These libraries are intended high performance compilers are black boxes source code goes one end magic happens the middle and object files assemblies come out the other end compilers perform their magic they build deep understanding the code they are processing but that knowledge unavailable anyone but the compiler implementation wizards The information promptly forgotten after the translated output produced For decades this world view has served well but longer sufficient Increasingly rely integrated development environment IDE features such IntelliSense refactoring intelligent rename Find all references and definition increase our productivity rely code analysis tools improve our code quality and code generators aid application construction these tools get smarter they need access more and more the deep code knowledge that only compilers possess This the core mission the NET Compiler Platform Roslyn opening the black boxes and allowing tools and end users share the wealth information compilers have about our code Instead being opaque source code and object code out translators through the NET Compiler Platform Roslyn compilers become platforms APIs that you can use for code related tasks your tools and applications The transition compilers platforms dramatically lowers the barrier entry for creating code focused tools and applications creates many opportunities for innovation areas such meta programming code generation and transformation interactive use the and languages and embedding and domain specific languages The NET Compiler Platform Roslyn SDK Preview includes the latest drafts new language object models for code generation analysis and refactoring hope include drafts API support for scripting and interactive use and Visual Basic future preview This document provides conceptual overview the NET Compiler Platform Roslyn Further details can found the walkthroughs and samples included the SDK Preview Exposing the Compiler APIs Compiler Pipeline Functional Areas The NET Compiler Platform Roslyn exposes the and Visual Basic compiler code analysis you consumer providing API layer that mirrors traditional compiler pipeline image images compiler pipeline png Each phase this pipeline now separate component First the parse phase where source tokenized and parsed into syntax that follows the language grammar Second the declaration phase where declarations from source and imported metadata are analyzed form named symbols Next the bind phase where identifiers the code are matched symbols Finally the emit phase where all the information built the compiler emitted assembly image images compiler pipeline api png Corresponding each those phases object model surfaced that allows access the information that phase The parsing phase exposed syntax tree the declaration phase hierarchical symbol table the binding phase model that exposes the result the compiler semantic analysis and the emit phase API that produces byte codes image images compiler pipeline lang svc png Each compiler combines these components together single end end whole ensure that the public Compiler APIs are sufficient for building world class IDE features the language services that will used power the and experiences Visual Studio vNext have been rebuilt using them For instance the code outlining and formatting features use the syntax trees the Object Browser and navigation features use the symbol table refactorings and Definition use the semantic model and Edit and Continue uses all these including the Emit API These experiences may previewed Visual Studio 2013 through the Roslyn End User Preview This preview required order build and test applications build top the NET Compiler Platform Roslyn SDK meant for integration into Visual Studio though the NET Compiler Platform Roslyn APIs can used your own applications independently Visual Studio without requiring the End User Preview API Layers The NET Compiler Platform Roslyn consists two main layers APIs the Compiler APIs and Workspaces APIs image images alex api layers png Compiler APIs The compiler layer contains the object models that correspond with information exposed each phase the compiler pipeline both syntactic and semantic The compiler layer also contains immutable snapshot single invocation compiler including assembly references compiler options and source code files There are two distinct APIs that represent the language and the Visual Basic language These two APIs are similar shape but tailored for high fidelity each individual language This layer has dependencies Visual Studio components Diagnostic APIs part their analysis the compiler may produce set diagnostics covering everything from syntax semantic and definite assignment errors various warnings and informational diagnostics The Compiler API layer exposes diagnostics through extensible API allowing for user defined analyzers plugged into Compilation and user defined diagnostics such those produced tools like StyleCop FxCop produced alongside compiler defined diagnostics Producing diagnostics this way has the benefit integrating naturally with tools such MSBuild and Visual Studio which depend diagnostics for experiences such halting build based policy and showing live squiggles the editor and suggesting code fixes Scripting APIs part the compiler layer the team prototyped hosting scripting APIs for executing code snippets and accumulating runtime execution context The REPL used these APIs but neither the REPL nor the Scripting APIs are part the NET Compiler Platform project currently The team reviewing these designs before introducing these components Workspaces APIs The Workspaces layer contains the Workspace API which the starting point for doing code analysis and refactoring over entire solutions assists you organizing all the information about the projects solution into single object model offering you direct access the compiler layer object models without needing parse files configure options manage project project dependencies addition the Workspaces layer surfaces set commonly used APIs used when implementing code analysis and refactoring tools that function within host environment like the Visual Studio IDE such the Find All References Formatting and Code Generation APIs This layer has dependencies Visual Studio components Working with Syntax The most fundamental data structure exposed the Compiler APIs the syntax tree These trees represent the lexical and syntactic structure source code They serve two important purposes allow tools such IDE add ins code analysis tools and refactorings see and process the syntactic structure source code user project enable tools such refactorings and IDE create modify and rearrange source code natural manner without having use direct text edits creating and manipulating trees tools can easily create and rearrange source code Syntax Trees Syntax trees are the primary structure used for compilation code analysis binding refactoring IDE features and code generation part the source code understood without first being identified and categorized into one many well known structural language elements Syntax trees have three key attributes The first attribute that syntax trees hold all the source information full fidelity This means that the syntax tree contains every piece information found the source text every grammatical construct every lexical token and everything else between including whitespace comments and preprocessor directives For example each literal mentioned the source represented exactly was typed The syntax trees also represent errors source code when the program incomplete malformed representing skipped missing tokens the syntax tree This enables the second attribute syntax trees syntax tree obtained from the parser completely round trippable back the text was parsed from From any syntax node possible get the text representation the sub tree rooted that node This means that syntax trees can used way construct and edit source text creating tree you have implication created the equivalent text and editing syntax tree making new tree out changes existing tree you have effectively edited the text The third attribute syntax trees that they are immutable and thread safe This means that after tree obtained snapshot the current state the code and never changes This allows multiple users interact with the same syntax tree the same time different threads without locking duplication Because the trees are immutable and modifications can made directly tree factory methods help create and modify syntax trees creating additional snapshots the tree The trees are efficient the way they reuse underlying nodes the new version can rebuilt fast and with little extra memory syntax tree literally tree data structure where non terminal structural elements parent other elements Each syntax tree made nodes tokens and trivia Syntax Nodes Syntax nodes are one the primary elements syntax trees These nodes represent syntactic constructs such declarations statements clauses and expressions Each category syntax nodes represented separate class derived from SyntaxNode The set node classes not extensible All syntax nodes are non terminal nodes the syntax tree which means they always have other nodes and tokens children child another node each node has parent node that can accessed through the Parent property Because nodes and trees are immutable the parent node never changes The root the tree has null parent Each node has ChildNodes method which returns list child nodes sequential order based its position the source text This list does not contain tokens Each node also has collection Descendant methods such DescendantNodes DescendantTokens DescendantTrivia that represent list all the nodes tokens trivia that exist the sub tree rooted that node addition each syntax node subclass exposes all the same children through strongly typed properties For example BinaryExpressionSyntax node class has three additional properties specific binary operators Left OperatorToken and Right The type Left and Right ExpressionSyntax and the type OperatorToken SyntaxToken Some syntax nodes have optional children For example IfStatementSyntax has optional ElseClauseSyntax the child not present the property returns null Syntax Tokens Syntax tokens are the terminals the language grammar representing the smallest syntactic fragments the code They are never parents other nodes tokens Syntax tokens consist keywords identifiers literals and punctuation For efficiency purposes the SyntaxToken type CLR value type Therefore unlike syntax nodes there only one structure for all kinds tokens with mix properties that have meaning depending the kind token that being represented For example integer literal token represents numeric value addition the raw source text the token spans the literal token has Value property that tells you the exact decoded integer value This property typed Object because may one many primitive types The ValueText property tells you the same information the Value property however this property always typed String identifier source text may include Unicode escape characters yet the syntax the escape sequence itself not considered part the identifier name although the raw text spanned the token does include the escape sequence the ValueText property does not Instead includes the Unicode characters identified the escape Syntax Trivia Syntax trivia represent the parts the source text that are largely insignificant for normal understanding the code such whitespace comments and preprocessor directives Because trivia are not part the normal language syntax and can appear anywhere between any two tokens they are not included the syntax tree child node Yet because they are important when implementing feature like refactoring and maintain full fidelity with the source text they exist part the syntax tree You can access trivia inspecting token LeadingTrivia TrailingTrivia collections When source text parsed sequences trivia are associated with tokens general token owns any trivia after the same line the next token Any trivia after that line associated with the following token The first token the source file gets all the initial trivia and the last sequence trivia the file tacked onto the end file token which otherwise has zero width Unlike syntax nodes and tokens syntax trivia not have parents Yet because they are part the tree and each associated with single token you may access the token associated with using the Token property Like syntax tokens trivia are value types The single SyntaxTrivia type used describe all kinds trivia Spans Each node token trivia knows its position within the source text and the number characters consists text position represented bit integer which zero based Unicode character index TextSpan object the beginning position and count characters both represented integers TextSpan has zero length refers location between two characters Each node has two TextSpan properties Span and FullSpan The Span property the text span from the start the first token the node sub tree the end the last token This span does not include any leading trailing trivia The FullSpan property the text span that includes the node normal span plus the span any leading trailing trivia For example sourceCode this bad throw new Exception Not right better exception The statement node inside the block has span indicated the single vertical bars includes the characters throw new Exception Not right The full span indicated the double vertical bars includes the same characters the span and the characters associated with the leading and trailing trivia Kinds Each node token trivia has RawKind property type System Int32 that identifies the exact syntax element represented This value can cast language specific enumeration each language has single SyntaxKind enumeration that lists all the possible nodes tokens and trivia elements the grammar This conversion can done automatically accessing the CSharpSyntaxKind VisualBasicSyntaxKind extension methods The RawKind property allows for easy disambiguation syntax node types that share the same node class For tokens and trivia this property the only way distinguish one type element from another For example single BinaryExpressionSyntax class has Left OperatorToken and Right children The Kind property distinguishes whether AddExpression SubtractExpression MultiplyExpression kind syntax node Errors Even when the source text contains syntax errors full syntax tree that round trippable the source exposed When the parser encounters code that does not conform the defined syntax the language uses one two techniques create syntax tree First the parser expects particular kind token but does not find may insert missing token into the syntax tree the location that the token was expected missing token represents the actual token that was expected but has empty span and its IsMissing property returns true Second the parser may skip tokens until finds one where can continue parsing this case the skipped tokens that were skipped are attached trivia node with the kind SkippedTokens Working with Semantics Syntax trees represent the lexical and syntactic structure source code Although this information alone enough describe all the declarations and logic the source not enough information identify what being referenced For example many types fields methods and local variables with the same name may spread throughout the source Although each these uniquely different determining which one identifier actually refers often requires deep understanding the language rules There are program elements represented source code and programs can also refer previously compiled libraries packaged assembly files Although source code available for assemblies and therefore syntax nodes trees programs can still refer elements inside them addition syntactic model the source code semantic model encapsulates the language rules giving you easy way make these distinctions Compilation compilation representation everything needed compile Visual Basic program which includes all the assembly references compiler options and source files Because all this information one place the elements contained the source code can described more detail The compilation represents each declared type member variable symbol The compilation contains variety methods that help you find and relate the symbols that have either been declared the source code imported metadata from assembly Similar syntax trees compilations are immutable After you create compilation cannot changed you anyone else you might sharing with However you can create new compilation from existing compilation specifying change you For example you might create compilation that the same every way existing compilation except may include additional source file assembly reference Symbols symbol represents distinct element declared the source code imported from assembly metadata Every namespace type method property field event parameter local variable represented symbol variety methods and properties the Compilation type help you find symbols For example you can find symbol for declared type its common metadata name You can also access the entire symbol table tree symbols rooted the global namespace Symbols also contain additional information that the compiler determined from the source metadata such other referenced symbols Each kind symbol represented separate interface derived from ISymbol each with its own methods and properties detailing the information the compiler has gathered Many these properties directly reference other symbols For example the ReturnType property the IMethodSymbol class tells you the actual type symbol that the method declaration referenced Symbols present common representation namespaces types and members between source code and metadata For example method that was declared source code and method that was imported from metadata are both represented IMethodSymbol with the same properties Symbols are similar concept the CLR type system represented the System Reflection API yet they are richer that they model more than just types Namespaces local variables and labels are all symbols addition symbols are representation language concepts not CLR concepts There lot overlap but there are many meaningful distinctions well For instance iterator method Visual Basic single symbol However when the iterator method translated CLR metadata type and multiple methods Semantic Model semantic model represents all the semantic information for single source file You can use discover the following The symbols referenced specific location source The resultant type any expression All diagnostics which are errors and warnings How variables flow and out regions source The answers more speculative questions Working with Workspace The Workspaces layer the starting point for doing code analysis and refactoring over entire solutions Within this layer the Workspace API assists you organizing all the information about the projects solution into single object model offering you direct access compiler layer object models like source text syntax trees semantic models and compilations without needing parse files configure options manage inter project dependencies Host environments like IDE provide workspace for you corresponding the open solution also possible use this model outside IDE simply loading solution file Workspace workspace active representation your solution collection projects each with collection documents workspace typically tied host environment that constantly changing user types manipulates properties The workspace provides access the current model the solution When change the host environment occurs the workspace fires corresponding events and the CurrentSolution property updated For example when the user types text editor corresponding one the source documents the workspace uses event signal that the overall model the solution has changed and which document was modified You can then react those changes analyzing the new model for correctness highlighting areas significance making suggestion for code change You can also create stand alone workspaces that are disconnected from the host environment used application that has host environment Solutions Projects Documents Although workspace may change every time key pressed you can work with the model the solution isolation solution immutable model the projects and documents This means that the model can shared without locking duplication After you obtain solution instance from the Workspace CurrentSolution property that instance will never change However like with syntax trees and compilations you can modify solutions constructing new instances based existing solutions and specific changes get the workspace reflect your changes you must explicitly apply the changed solution back the workspace project part the overall immutable solution model represents all the source code documents parse and compilation options and both assembly and project project references From project you can access the corresponding compilation without needing determine project dependencies parse any source files document also part the overall immutable solution model document represents single source file from which you can access the text the file the syntax tree and the semantic model The following diagram representation how the Workspace relates the host environment tools and how edits are made image images workspace obj relations png Summary The NET Compiler Platform Roslyn exposes set Compiler APIs and Workspaces APIs that provides rich information about your source code and that has full fidelity with the and Visual Basic languages The transition compilers platform dramatically lowers the barrier entry for creating code focused tools and applications creates many opportunities for innovation areas such meta programming code generation and transformation interactive use the and languages and embedding and domain specific languages

api/!api/System.Linq.ParallelExecutionMo.title: ParallelExecutionMode Default ForceParallelism
api/!api/System.Linq.ParallelExecutionMo.keywords: System Linq ParallelExecutionMode The query execution mode hint that specifies how the system should handle performance trade offs when parallelizing queries System Linq ParallelExecutionMode Default default the system will use algorithms for queries that are ripe for parallelism and will avoid algorithms with high overheads that will likely result slow downs for parallel execution System Linq ParallelExecutionMode ForceParallelism Parallelize the entire query even that means using high overhead algorithms

api/!api/System.Linq.ParallelMergeOption.title: ParallelMergeOptions Default NotBuffered AutoBuffered FullyBuffered
api/!api/System.Linq.ParallelMergeOption.keywords: System Linq ParallelMergeOptions Specifies the preferred type output merge use query This hint only and may not respected the system when parallelizing all queries para Use NotBuffered for queries that will consumed and output streams this has the lowest latency between beginning query execution and elements being yielded For some queries such those involving sort OrderBy OrderByDescending buffering essential and hint NotBuffered AutoBuffered will ignored para para Use AutoBuffered for most cases this the default strikes balance between latency and overall performance para para Use FullyBuffered for queries when the entire output can processed before the information needed This option offers the best performance when all the output can accumulated before yielding any information though not suitable for stream processing showing partial results mid query para System Linq ParallelMergeOptions Default Use the default merge type which AutoBuffered System Linq ParallelMergeOptions NotBuffered Use merge without output buffers soon result elements have been computed make that element available the consumer the query System Linq ParallelMergeOptions AutoBuffered Use merge with output buffers size chosen the system Results will accumulate into output buffer before they are available the consumer the query System Linq ParallelMergeOptions FullyBuffered Use merge with full output buffers The system will accumulate all the results before making any them available the consumer the query

api/!api/System.Linq.Expressions.IArgume.keywords: System Linq Expressions IArgumentProvider Provides internal interface for accessing the arguments that multiple tree nodes DynamicExpression ElementInit MethodCallExpression InvocationExpression NewExpression and InexExpression This enables two optimizations which reduce the size the trees The first enables the nodes hold onto IList instead ReadOnlyCollection This saves the cost allocating the ReadOnlyCollection for each node The second that enables specialized subclasses created which hold onto specific number arguments For example Block2 Block3 Block4 These nodes can therefore avoid allocating both ReadOnlyCollection and array for storing their elements saving bytes per node Meanwhile the nodes can continue expose the original LINQ properties ReadOnlyCollections They this using field for storing both the array element that would normally stored the array For the array case the collection typed IList instead ReadOnlyCollection When the node initially constructed array When the compiler accesses the members uses this interface user accesses the members the array promoted ReadOnlyCollection For the object case store the 1st argument field typed object and when the node initially constructed this holds directly onto the Expression When the compiler accesses the members again uses this interface and the accessor for the 1st argument uses Expression ReturnObject return the object which handles the Expression ReadOnlyCollection case When the user accesses the ReadOnlyCollection then the object field updated hold directly onto the ReadOnlyCollection important that the Expressions consistently return the same ReadOnlyCollection otherwise the writer will broken and would breaking change from LINQ The problem that currently users can rely object identity tell the node has changed Storing the readonly collection overloaded field enables both reduce memory usage well maintain compatibility and easy use external API System Linq Expressions IArgumentProvider GetArgument System Int32 System Linq Expressions IArgumentProvider ArgumentCount

api/!api/System.Reflection.AssemblyHashA.title: AssemblyHashAlgorithm None MD5 Sha1 Sha256 Sha384 Sha512
api/!api/System.Reflection.AssemblyHashA.keywords: System Reflection AssemblyHashAlgorithm Specifies all the hash algorithms used for hashing assembly files and for generating the strong name System Reflection AssemblyHashAlgorithm None mask indicating that there hash algorithm you specify None for multi module assembly the common language runtime defaults the SHA1 algorithm since multi module assemblies need generate hash System Reflection AssemblyHashAlgorithm MD5 Retrieves the MD5 message digest algorithm MD5 was developed Rivest 1991 basically MD4 with safety belts and while slightly slower than MD4 helps provide more security The algorithm consists four distinct rounds which has slightly different design from that MD4 Message digest size well padding requirements remain the same System Reflection AssemblyHashAlgorithm Sha1 Retrieves revision the Secure Hash Algorithm that corrects unpublished flaw SHA System Reflection AssemblyHashAlgorithm Sha256 Retrieves version the Secure Hash Algorithm with hash size 256 bits System Reflection AssemblyHashAlgorithm Sha384 Retrieves version the Secure Hash Algorithm with hash size 384 bits System Reflection AssemblyHashAlgorithm Sha512 Retrieves version the Secure Hash Algorithm with hash size 512 bits

api/!api/System.Reflection.DeclarativeSe.title: DeclarativeSecurityAction None Demand Assert Deny PermitOnly LinkDemand InheritanceDemand RequestMinimum RequestOptional RequestRefuse
api/!api/System.Reflection.DeclarativeSe.keywords: System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction Specifies the security actions that can performed using declarative security System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction None declarative security action System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction Demand Check that all callers the call chain have been granted specified permission System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction Assert The calling code can access the resource identified the current permission object even callers higher the stack have not been granted permission access the resource System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction Deny Without further checks refuse Demand for the specified permission System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction PermitOnly Without further checks refuse Demand for all permissions other than those specified System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction LinkDemand Check that the immediate caller has been granted the specified permission System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction InheritanceDemand The derived class inheriting the class overriding method required have been granted the specified permission System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction RequestMinimum The request for the minimum permissions required for code run This action can only used within the scope the assembly System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction RequestOptional The request for additional permissions that are optional not required run This request implicitly refuses all other permissions not specifically requested This action can only used within the scope the assembly System Reflection DeclarativeSecurityAction RequestRefuse The request that permissions that might misused will not granted the calling code This action can only used within the scope the assembly

false such that the block may used multiple producers concurrently This property should only set true the code using the block can guarantee that will only ever used one producer source linked the block time meaning that methods like Post Complete Fault and OfferMessage will never called concurrently Some blocks may choose capitalize the knowledge that there will only one producer time order provide better performance
